Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I think the best method will be to store tx to send and group them. That way on each coinserver, properly configured, it will loop through all assets to see if there is work incoming

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Will allow better resource management than going wild sending x tx at each trade

Author: Deleted User#0000

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: just finished to rewrite addressgen and searchtx to allow use of as many servers as needed, the process is fairly simple : admins wanting to add a server just add a row in the table, and then the scripts will automatically split the charge across servers

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: the reason of it is clearly Z tx

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: as they are resource intensive,we can imagine having like 10 servers handling Z

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: scaling is also possible for T

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: that means even in case of a servercrash, just a command typed on db can allow to pop up a second server with the same exact set of addresses to handle

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: those options will be done afterwards, but basically, possibilities to add coins and servers are not limited anymore

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: (options for hotswapping from one server to another)

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: if used also for T tx, it can also be useful to improve SLA, as maintenance nodes won t hurt the system, imagine 2 servers out of 3 are down for maintenance, the 3rd still works, so the scripts will only send to alive servers

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: having a maintenance will obviously freeze people hosted on the server in maintenance, but won't harm the whole process

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: (and in case it s too long, a duplicate of params across servers will also be possible, not a big deal, but..... afterwards)
